Description: Stamp (vessel): mikyala. Measure of white sesame seed. Part of five lines of inscription. Made of green glass. Broken at left and bottom.
Curator's comments: The type does not appear to have been published before but it has been possible to supplement the reading and remove the doubt that would have existed about the name of the commodity from a specimen from the same die in the Victoria and Albert Museum.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (207)
